intro: Microstachys ditassoides subsp. villosa, commonly known as the hairy leaved stachys, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
